Title: Stability of ironcrystal structures at 0.3-1.5 TPa
Abstract: © 2014 Elsevier B.V.Ab initio molecular dynamics simulations carried out for tetragonal and orthorhombic distortions of iron closely follow the results of static-lattice electronic-structure calculations in revealing that the body-centered cubic (. bcc) phase of Fe is mechanically unstable at pressures of 0.3-1.5 TPa and temperatures up to 7000 K. Crystal-structural instabilities originate in the static lattice for the bcc configuration, and are consistent with recent results from both static and dynamic high-pressure experiments. Both theory and experiment thus show that the close-packed (hexagonal, hcp and face-centered cubic, fcc) crystal structures of iron are those relevant to the cores of Earth-like planets.
